Description: Textile fragments; seven lengths/fragments of torn strips of cloth, with one line of text or with vignettes painted on them. Fragment ii, v and vii feature text. Fragments i, iii, iv and vi have vignettes. The vignettes are from Chapter 16 of The Book of the Dead. The text, on the other hand, appears to be funerary, but not from The Book of the Dead (written in very late Hieratic text).
Curator's comments: Published in: Regulski, I. (ed.), 2022. Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt, pp. 193-4

Medium quality linen, apparently undyed, now unevenly buff coloured with darker stains (possibly of resin). Side edges are torn, end are mostly ragged. At one end of ii) is a knotless warp fring, cut off, and preceded by two bands of bare warp, each 6cm deep. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S- spun only; the stitch gauge is warp c.27-33 ends per 10mm and weft c.9-10 picks per 10mm. Information from Hero Granger-Taylor [1994]: Fragments were originally catalogued as separate items, but have since been identified as belonging together. Therefore, BM 15039 is now 15039, i BM 15040 is now 15039 ii BM 15042 is now 15039 iii BM 15048 is now 15039 iv BM 15049 is now 15039 v BM 15050 is now 15039 vi BM 99609 is now 15039 vii
Exhibition history: 2015, 19th June - 5th Sept. Wrexham County Borough Museum. Egyptian Written Culture. 2016 12 Mar-8 May, Carlisle, Tullie House, Writing for Eternity 2016 20 May-4 Sept, The Salisbury Museum, Writing for Eternity 2016 16 Sept-10 Jan 2017, Abergavenny Museum, Writing for Eternity 2017 21 Jan-21 May, Museum of Hartlepool, Writing for Eternity 2022-2023 13 Oct-19 Feb, London, BM, Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
